description:
A cute family owned business, based on what I can tell when I visit. Since I started my new job, this has been my go to cafe for an iced vanilla latte or even a small sandwich. There's never a line and they are always ready to jump in and take your order. The prices are very fair and they have quite a big selection of fresh pastries on a daily basis. Just today I decided to try the tuna sandwich on rye bread and it was a good choice! The bread was toasted and not burnt, which is a common problem. The tuna was very fresh and chunky. The lettuce and tomatoes were also placed inside the sandwich and they were a great addition, without making the sandwich soggy. I paid around$7-$8 dollars and the sandwich was well worth it. I'll be coming back to try another one of their menu items, possibly a panini :D 

If you're around the area and looking for a quick bite to eat, this is the place to go!
author: Julia K.

description:
I was in the area and stopped here for a cup of coffee. Ps. The cafe is full of plants !! Literally. That is what initially caught my attention. 

I got a small coffee ($1.50) which was extremely well priced for a nice cup of coffee. It had good flavour and tasted fresh. 

Note : The minimum card order is $1.00 which is very convenient too. 

The interiors are designed to be a funky cafe full of books and plants. There was one lady at the counter making all the orders and she is very efficient, not much of a talker. 

If you want coffee on the go or sit in a quirky space and enjoy it , this would be the place !
author: Shivani B.

description: Nice, no frills for basic cup and table to work/read. There is a sign that says wifi with minimum $3 purchase. Of your lucky you can snatch the couch. Plants make the place look much cozier. The pace has a neighborhood feel
author: Ilya K.

description: Agree w other Yelpers abt dry pastries. Ordered a chicken salad sandwich ($7.95). Cheese is extra 50 cents. Lots of seating for 1pm lunch. Chicken salad had lots of flavor from mayo, purple onion. Small sized sandwich though. Overall, decent experience but like others say no big wow.
author: Thomas L.

description: Great place for cup cakes and very friendly team....delicious cup cakes with variety.
author: Kalpana T.

description: If you're trying to get work done, this is a superb place to do so. It's very quiet, and they have really comfy chairs in the back.
author: Majid A.

description: Friendly service, wifi, relaxed and quiet place to enjoy a cup of coffee, bagel, + with a friend or a book
author: lynn t.

description:
Service: 
My coworkers and I come here all the time. The baristas are always really quick and have a smile on their face. 

Eats: 
Their breakfast sandwiches are a good deal compared to other coffee shops in the area. I also got a caramel macchiato and found it to be really bitter. My coworkers get regular coffee all the time though, and have no complaints. 

Ambiance: 
Lots of seating in here, albeit random tables and chairs. There's even a large table in the back that could seat 8.
author: Susan G.

description:
The lady who works here is very nice however their pastries are not very fresh. The white chunk macadamia nut cookie was dry as f and the tiramisu tasted like it had been sitting there for a while. 

I haven't tried their drinks, but if their pastries aren't fresh, I doubt anything else you get here will taste good.
author: Jenny C.

description: Quick service. Hot bagel sandwich was tasty and a good size. Also got a almond chai ice latte. The flavors were good but not amazing. Not too much ice compared to SB. The substitution cost extra but I wasnt told until I ask for a 2nd receipt. I think she threw away the first one. I asked for no dairy and there was a minor mistake with the bagel. I tasted butter. Customer service was so-so depending if you are a regular or not. Nice comfortable environment with lots of vegetation. Quiet in the morning and comfortable but I can image it can get crowded and stuffy. Not a lot of air circulation and I see a couple of fans set up. Overall I think it's a nice spot to grab a quick bite and drink if you're in the neighborhood. A good neighborhood hangout but nothing amazing.
author: Alice P.

description:
I like all the plants in the barrels! It's a bit of a half-baked rustic look. Been meaning to check this place out for a while. I like their name- it's cute. 
I'm getting a veggie bagel today usually I try places out by sampling their cappuccinos but I'm on a caffeine break so that will wait another time! 
It would be nice if their music wasn't the radio because I hate listening to commercials!
author: Nani B.

description: I just had a worst-than-a-grocery-market-but-expensive-like-a-real-bakery-made cupcake here for almost $3. They don't even make the cupcakes here.
author: Hanster P.

description:
A little shop that would be excellent if you're looking for a place to do some work. If you live close to this place, then it's perfect! I have to drive here, so I'd only be out here if I had other things to do on Geary.

I've been looking for cafes that offer pots of tea rather than a single cup. Cup & Cake easily has the best value. They give you a sizeable teapot, and if you ask, you can actually get some decent loose leaf teas instead of the tea bags. Plus, it's only $4! I ordered tea and a sandwich and stayed there for about an hour. I still had about half a pot left; I asked for a to-go cup and was pleased to find that half the pot could fit in a rather large cup. I also had to get a cupcake...because I mean, this place is called Cup & Cake! It was all right. Nothing to write home about.

I imagine this place sees a lot of different folks in San Francisco, so to me it really felt like a nice little neighborhood shop. The cashier was friendly and the guy making my sandwich had a sort of quiet veneer about him. She had a lovely demeanor, and he had a strict face but seemed to be the kind of guy who would quietly do something nice for you without you noticing.

I'll be back if I'm in the area!
author: Robbin A.

description: I feel badly knocking a family-run business, but...I have purchased pastries here twice and they were not fresh. Both times they tasted dry and stale. I had to throw them away.
author: Morris R.

description:
I'm not a coffee person, so I got a chai and a cream filled chocolate cake. I can confirm that the chai was quite tasty, definitely above average. The chocolate cake was also super decadent and tasty. The prices were about average for what you'd expect in SF for this stuff...$8.50 total including tax and tip.  

The atmosphere is pretty great. It's very spacious and the plans really help it feel less crowded. This would be a great "third place" when you need to get away. 

I give it 4 stars just because nothing sings to me about this place. It's great and I'd come here again, but there's no reason I'd be excited to do so.
author: Chris S.

description:
A fairly large space that's kinda sorta decorated with a rustic western theme, maybe? I dunno but it's fairly clean and the staff were friendly. I really like how the bags of potato chips were organised and displayed, they looked very "branded".

I ordered an americano and a panini to go.

the americano was served quickly and was pretty good.

After waiting a bit I got my sammich, when i went to eat it i found it wasn't a panini. Just the meat and cheese were warm but the sandwich was not grilled. This is a big pet peeve of mine. It really bothers me when restaurants don't actually serve you the food they say they will. Maybe they just don't know what a panini is.

I'm really close to giving this place 2 stars but the coffee was good and I haven't tried anything else so ill give them the benefit of the doubt.
author: aaron t.

description:
I've been coming here consistently for 4 years now. Solid breakfast and lunch options when you're not looking for too many frills. If you're in a hurry, I highly suggest calling your order in 10-15 minutes before getting to the cafe. 

My usual order: Sunrise bagel - egg, cheese, and choice of protein/bagel + house coffee. They also have a variety of baked goods/pastries which are pretty lackluster, but if you're in a hurry and in the area, it does the deed. They also sell snacks like yogurt, chips, potato salad, some fruits, kombucha, etc. if you need a little pick me up.

I come here for the convenience. It's a great place to work- bigger cafe with lots of seating, easy access to outlets, free wifi with coffee/food purchase. I also adore the staff, the owners are super friendly which earned them another star in my opinion.
author: Janet P.

description: I love this place! We come here often to grab breakfast sandwiches and coffee. Their prices are so reasonable and everything is tasty. We usually get things to go since we live nearby, but the inside of the cafe is super spacious and comfortable. Tons of seating. The people who work here are so friendly and they remember their repeat customers. Sometimes I call ahead if I'm going to pick up an order, and then there's no waiting for the sandwich to be made. This is just an all around gem in the neighborhood, and I hope it stays open for years to come.
author: Traci R.

description: I come here weekly to get deli sandwiches. I have not tried the other menu items but the deli meat is fresh and the sandwiches are tasty! Roast beef with American cheese is my recommendation.
author: M H.

description: Wonderful for doing work! The plants and natural light are great ambiance. Also I've never seen it completely full so I dont get as distracted as i might at other cafes. Lots of seating options - it's nice to unwind or concentrate w a pot of tea here !
author: Fel I.

description: I like Cup and Cake for good coffee, sandwiches, breakfast bagels, sweets, wifi, and service. Owners of this establishment are very nice. Consistent quality every time. Clean and comfortable cafe.  Thank you Cup and Cake.
author: Chen W.

description:
Visited here in the middle of the day because had an hour to kill. Randomly chose this place, walked in, and found it very odd (mismatched decor, no central theme) but it was interesting to look at everything and take my pick of which chair or couch to sit at. 

There wasn't a lot of people here when I arrived and stayed the same when I left about half an hour later. There was a party of two talking a little loudly in the back, a mother and child waiting on sandwiches, and few other customers scattered around the cafe. 

I ordered a breakfast bagel with ham, egg, and cheese on an onion bagel and a small hot chocolate. The breakfast bagel was very delicious, a little bit too much pepper (I didn't mind it much), and was the perfect size for a small lunch. I was surprised by how many different bagels they had and their selection of treats from huge cookies to a variety of refrigerated drinks. The hot chocolate stayed extremely hot for an hour! By the time I tried it, it was not overly sweet (unlike what you would find at starbucks, for example). 

Overall, would definitely visit again if I was in the area! The lady working that day was very nice as well and was happy to change my order to a to-go order after asking.
author: Cassy Y.

description: I like to stop in sometimes to grab a sandwich and ice latte to go, and I've always had really delicious, consistent food and drinks. I've also tried their blended drinks and they're super tasty! I haven't tried the pastries yet but I've had a few different sandwiches and the ingredients are always fresh. The ladies who work here are very nice. I would definitely recommend this cafe.
author: Kate A.

description:
Cup & Cake has lots of space, only 1/2 is utilized.

menu: paninis, sammies, cupcakes, macaroons, cookies, expressos, muffins, crossaints, etc.

eats: (ultimate cookie)white chocolate & macadamian nut (1.95)
-crunchy, sweet, nutty. near perfect
pour: (m) 1.85
-tasted organic dark roast, very bold.
well worth it 3.5 stars

drips:
-only metered parking available
-free meter need to walk a bit.
author: Victor G.

description: Good breakfast sandwiches and coffee. Better than the others in the area.
author: Ivana Y.

description: Conveniently located on Geary a couple blocks away from USF, Cup and Cake is a quiet, cozy, and roomy cafe. In terms of drink selections, Cup and Cake is average with all the classics. But where this place shines is the tiny deli they have that cranks out some tasty breakfast items! I was pleasantly surprised to find the Lox bagel absolutely delicious. The bagel arrived cut in half, you could instantly smell the lox and the sharp smell of onions. The cream cheese was not overwhelming at all, just the perfect amount. I also found the alfalfa sprouts surprisingly original and they gave it that earthy taste. Everything came together with the capers closing down the show.  I would highly suggest peeking into this underrated spot and giving it a try, I'm 200% sure you'll be extremely satisfied from the atmosphere to the food and coffee.
author: Elias B.

description:
Nice place, excellent coffee, good food, fine service. Locally owned so big points there.

I can say their coffee tastes different than Starbucks or Peets, and I like all three. Asking which is better is simply not fair, like asking whether Macallans, Bowmore, or Oban is better. It depends on the day you ask.

You cannot go wrong here.
author: E F.

description: I've been going here for years and the owners are consistently nice and thougtful to me and my kid. A great, solid family business!
author: B K.

description: Love this place to study, drink coffee/teas, eat sandwiches, meet up with friends, etc. They have lots of sitting area and plants. The front area has lots of windows that bring in natural light. I prefer coming here than the other two cafes near by- Fifty/Fifty and Earth's Coffee. The couple, Jenny and Steve, are very nice and friendly.
author: Sharon J.

description:
The food is solid  as is the Coffee, but the reason for 5 stars is that there is no better coffee shop to study, work, etc. 

Parking is easy to find, there is a lot of open space, free wi-fi, and anytime I need to get something done this is the place to go.
author: Ryan G.

description:
I go there often to work. The place is cosy and comfy, I feel good there.
The service is good, they are always smiling and fun.

I usually take breakfast there and it is good: the elvis bagel makes me crazy.

The location is great: at in interesection with huge windows, it is a great pleasure to work in the sun.

CONS: the coffee is always super hot and you might burn your lips. But like always.

I recommend this place to anyone who wants to work/study outside from home but bring your headphone on saturday afternoon: there is this noisy group of people who tchat really loudly.
author: Tarek A.

description:
The people are really pleasant, but they refrigerate their cupcakes. This is a huge no-no for me. I don't want hard, cold icing over dry, flaky cake. I want moist deliciousness made of chocolate and sugar.

On the upside, there is free internet (or so I've heard) and lots of seating. It's a really convenient location - right on Geary, close to the bus, near a tattoo shop...

Just don't put "cake" in the name of your cafe if you're going to massacre the properties normally found in a truly awesome cupcake.
author: Jiordan C.

description:
Restroom?

So here is something humiliating.  No thanks to my caffeine-addicted ass, I had a strong Breve Latte from the Peet's in the neighborhood and lo and behold, the strong urge created by something potent as a diuretic kicked in when I was walking with the fellow down Geary for a little photo opportunistic romp.

First off the fast food joints located on this strip of Geary have absolutely no public restrooms, probably due to the fact that the homeless/drunk partygoers would make a mess and take advantage of the free paper towels/dryers/water there.  Second, where are the typical Starbuck/Peet's cafes here?

So it was only a matter of time that my nervous ticking calmed down a bit when we came upon this establishment, located right on an open corner.  The interior is long and mostly filled upfront with either students or locals looking to read a book over their drinks and chat quietly amongst themselves.  The chairs here are like the smoking chairs found in old school clubs where only men are allowed: wide, cushioned and gone in sixty seconds if you don't lay claim to it immediately.

The shop seems to be run by a local family, kind and cheerful.  I ordered an iced tea, in order to make up for my ignorance in drinking a vat of coffee prior to going on a walk AND for utilizing their facilities.  Apparently, there were more choices available for my generic iced tea.  The lady requested to know which tea?  Wow.........I was able to choose from the ten varieties of tea on the shelf, but I'm simple: Breakfast Black Tea.  Brewed and then after asking me about the amount of ice I preferred, she made it to perfection.

Delightful glassed display of cakes/pastries (probably brought in by an Asian bakery), bagels/sandwiches made to order........and simple drinks with a decent price tag attached to them.

Local, unpretentious, a wide space, lots of seating with comfortable chairs, good ice tea (I'll be back to try their other items) and great customer service.

Easily, a 5 star rating  : )
author: Miika M.

description: I can't say enough good things about this place.  It's spacious and never very crowded, it's probably the most affordable coffee in the city (unlike the other spot about a block away), friendly owners, good food (check out the Al Pollo sandwich), free WiFi, they take credit cards, relaxing environment.  It makes me feel good to support an independent business who works hard to be as great as they are.
author: Cesar C.

description: Love this place. Very friendly people, spacious surroundings, great coffee and I had a delicious chocolate/macaroon cake. Yum!!
author: Ricky F.

description: I really like this place for studying! The seating options are varied and plentiful, they have lots of herbal teas and a couple gluten free cookie options and everyone that works here is really nice! It's a calm atmosphere, great for focusing.
author: jean e.

description:
The inside is still reminicent of the liquor store that would sell me alcohol and cigarettes when I was a minor, but this little cafe is cool by me. 

Free WiFi
Clean
Never too crowded
Extensive menu

AND one of the BEST Bran Muffins i have eaver had.
author: Chelsey G.

description:
Admittedly, this was a random stop. I saw it on the side of the road, on Geary, as I did many times before and never having looked up the review, this place just SOUNDED good. So I popped in to give it a try since they were finally open.

The interior was a lot different than the exterior. I should have read Connie C's review! I was thinking of this place as well: http://www.yelp.com/biz/cups-and-cakes-bakery-san-francisco

The inside is very ... busy, there are tables and chairs and mismatching decor galore. I saw some red velvet and headed for it anyway. It was cheap, but in the end I was sordidly disappointed since it was not red velvet tasting at all and the frosting was so horrific I took a bite and tossed it.

I want to give this place the benefit of the doubt that perhaps they are a good coffee shop, but what a mistaken identity indeed.
author: Lorrie M.

description:
Great people and nice beverages, snacks and bagel sandwiches. It's nice to visit a locally owned place, get friendly, with the owners and relax and do some work.

Came here before a business lunch nearby (and have been here before). Am always pleased with the atmosphere.
author: Chris G.

description:
MOST COMFORTABLE CAFE IN INNER RICHMOND!
If you're into long lines for coffee, a noise level of an airport runway, lousy food, and a complex algorithm for the restroom door, stick with Starbuck's.  On the other hand, if you want the complete opposite, Cup & Cake is your best bet in SF.  The facility is very open (lots of space), and the chairs are so, so comfortable.  On one of my lunch stops, I almost fell asleep in the chair.  The food while not 5-star (it's a cafe) is of high quality ingredients, and the price is very reasonable especially for SF.  The place has WiFi so I think it's popular with the USF crowd.  This is a great place for either chilling-out by yourself or having a relaxed conversation with a group of friends.
author: Tom M.

description: The area is spacious, the prices are reasonable, and the wifi is awesome. The workers also seem incredibly patient - I really enjoyed it here.
author: Yena O.

description:
3 Stars

+ Clean
+ Friendly Service
+ Free Wifi
+ Accepts Credit Cards
+ Spacious

- Hard to find parking

Wayne and I stopped by Cup & Cake Cafe for some dessert after having lunch around the vicinity. Not a huge variety to choose from here but we did end up taking a few desserts home: a princess cake http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/iDm6Y-DCWtH3OXPaY4gbpA?select=ZQVTKn45wjsu0piBLNRgnA, red velvet cake http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/iDm6Y-DCWtH3OXPaY4gbpA?select=iyzcm5KZY3oUMMrtHlo75w, and fruit tart http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/iDm6Y-DCWtH3OXPaY4gbpA?select=Gdlo1tkz2IG6Tf6TbMlWkw.

Nothing really stood out for any of the desserts in my opinion. The princess cake was looked pretty, but the cake was dry. The red velvet cake tasted quite bland. The cake was moist but the frosting wasn't as cream cheesy as I expected. The fruit tart was the best out of the three. It wasn't overly sweet and the fruits on top were fresh.

Overall, this cafe looks like a great place to relax and enjoy a cup of joe. I'd come back for the free wi-fi but skip on the pastries.
author: Mona C.

description: Tasty coffees and cozy vibes, but it's a little bit hot in there. :D
author: Emily J.

description: I stopped here because I was craving something sweet! They have many treats to choose from but the chocolate dipped macaroon looked the best. I've never seen it in that shape and it was a generous size. It was fresh and delicious! The lady was very friendly too.
author: Regina W.

description: Perfect to work or simply have a coffee. Very good coffee, good prices. Many plants to give a comfortable atmosphere. Very friendly staff.
author: Sebastien E.

description:
Great place to study, read a book, or catch up with friends. Coffee is pretty good and the staff is always friendly. 

Sometimes parking can be difficult during the weekday afternoons.
author: Melissa Z.

description:
Solid cafe with all of the basic coffee and pastry offering's you'd expect.  The place is clean and conveniently located.

Docked a couple stars because:
- Decor is sparse and lacks warmth and character.  As others have noted, the space doesn't seem fully utilized.
- While the wifi was fast, the wifi password was very hard to remember, and kept on a piece of hard plastic.  So, getting on was a bit inconvenient

All said, it's a nice quiet place to hang out and enjoy a cup of coffee, and I'd go back.
author: Joseph C.

description:
I have been here twice. The 1st time I got a decaf latte and a croissant. The croissant was dry but the coffee was very good.

The next time I went with my husband. He got coffee with soymilk and the milk was really oily and looked rotten. He asked for more and was told it's fine. So he threw it away without drinking. I had another latte (whole milk ) which was fine. 

The atmosphere is extremely weird and unsettling, the front of the store is brightly lit and OK but there 's a giant dimly lit back area that is really creepy and when you're ordering and using the sugar & cream you're almost in the dark. It's odd and makes the whole place feel off. 

I like Cumaica's coffee down on Clement much better and would walk down there rather than come here again
author: Venus S.

description: Skip the fancy coffee, their lattes are scalding hot and not foamed at all. They do, however, make a mean ham and cheese sandwich on your choice of bagel or croissant. The pastry sections look delish too, they have free wi-fi and lots of room along with a semi-private couch area in the back.
author: Tatyana K.

description:
I stopped by this place today by pure luck. I had plans to go somewhere else to satisfy my sweet tooth, but while I was on the bus, I saw this cute store called cup and cake cafe! And I'm unable to resist cupcakes, so I hopped off at the next stop and decided to get something here instead.

After a lot of contemplation, I ordered a red velvet cupcake for #2. It was very cream cheesy on top, just the way I like it! But overall, I thought the cupcake tasted okay, but not spectacular. They had a lot of different assortments of baked goods too like carrot cake, red velvet cake, cookies, macaroons, chocolate dipped macaroons, cheesecake, and cake.

If I lived in San Francisco, this place would definitely be the place to go to use the internet and to do any type of work done. It's big, it has relatively cheap food, and it's comfortable. It's not as clean as other people say it is though.... but it's not trashy either.
author: Jeanette S.

description: I went in here for laptop-company-work-stuff, and nestled in CCC for a large latte. This cafe is quite large, with your usual uneven seats/chairs that marks the distinction of a non-corporate SBUX/PEET shop. The latte was good, but expensive. I think this used to be a liquor store. They probably could squeeze more seats in here to maximize their margins. Good corner spot, so you can gaze at the hectic Geary Blvd traffic going by.
author: Derek N.

description: Was hesitant when I walked in but the menu looked current and the pasteries seemed fresh so we decided to stay.  Their Americano and Lattes are good. I like the fact that it's quiet inside and yet you can sit and watch the cars and people outside.
author: Mashimaro M.

description: My boyfriend and I really enjoyed our turkey pannini with pesto which was quite large and shareable.  We were visiting from Wisconsin and were glad to find a place as reasonable as those back in Milwaukee.
author: Mary V.

description: This cute, local place has fabulous sandwiches, bagels and coffees. Ambiance is what makes the place... there are lots of cozy couches and good sized tables perfect for chatting with a friend or bringing your laptop. Quiet and the staff is friendly. My go-to spot in the neighborhood.
author: Liz W.

description: To start off their website is incorrect it says the cafe does not work on Fridays which is not true considering I was there Friday . The venue is pretty relaxing very spacious and I loved the music they played! However I would not go back the scone I got seemed like it's been in the cafe for weeks it was gross. I don't really recommend this cafe.
author: Elena P.

description: Great cafe. Super nice people.  I really enjoy their coffee, egg sandwiches, and a relaxing quiet read. Cup and cake is my go to cafe in the Inner Richmond.
author: Tim B.

description:
I came here to try their cupcakes (I figure, hey a cafe named after  the word "cupcake" must be good right?) Unfortunately their cupcakes are really bad. I tried the red velvet and chocolate cupcake and they were extremely dry. The frosting was better but overall I didn't enjoy it at all.
Cupcakes were cheap, under $2 for each.
I was going to get a slice of red velvet cake (maybe that would be more moist since the cupcake was kept out in a display container near the register) but I figure I would try that next time if I came back. 
Wouldn't mind returning to try some of their other desserts but would definitely not get cupcakes here again.
author: Miss H K.

description: Coffee sucks; super hot, burnt. Starbucks is better by far.
author: Russell S.

description:
Convenient coffee shop w/ free wifi near the Indian Consulate office.

I had to go to the Indian consulate last month for some work. I had to wait a bit after my initial visit. So I thought, why not scope the neighborhood and find a coffee shop with free wi-fi so that I can work a lil bit... yes! I love my work! :D 

Also had a veggie sandwich while I worked. The sandwich was good and so was the wifi strength.
author: Kinjal S.

description:
Half way there.

Homemade cakes are missing. Everything is from local bakeries.

But they do make a good turkey ciabatta sandwich (piled high though the turkey was bland grocery store variety) and Americanos with sugar free Irish cream syrup.

WiFi was as fast as the service. Windows are large and offer a nice view of the Inner Richmond world.

Come for the cup. Lower your expectations for the cake.
author: Jason B.

description:
Sandwich and drink shop with everything made right in front of you. Delicious and I probably could have made my meal at home for cheaper but I was too lazy. My veggie sandwich was delicious though and it tasted healthy. It was a good break from the long morning I had. 

A good place to come for a quick bite if you're not trying to look for anything special or particular.
author: Diana Y.

description:
It's nice to have a local hang out when you're wanting to get out of the house but not wanting to travel too far.
While I continue searching for one in my neck of the woods, I've also decided to visit others - so you may find me lurking around your part of town.

There is definitely a neighborhood vibe to the Cup & Cake Cafe.  During my visit, I saw a couple people working away on their laptops, coeds ordering food to go, and a round table filled with little old ladies drinking tea and sharing snacks.
It was nice to see the wide array of people who gather here.
 
I didn't find any outstanding dessert or noteworthy tea.
But it does fit the need of providing a sanctuary.

As for finding a place to call my own, I'm gonna have to give Java Beach a try.
author: Dan B.

description:
+
Big windows, quiet atmosphere, cheap (tea = 1.25 for a small)

-
Minimum purchase of $3.00 for internet code (but the at&t store nearby lets you access their free wifi) Too bright when sun rises, come after 10am
author: Brendan N.

description:
I love this place because they have the best chai latte in the city. I don't even live in the Richmond. I come from miles away, deep in the Sunset to get here. 

Yes, it's non-hipster vibe, free wifi, leather couches and open space is appealing as well. But it's the lattes and friendly service I get from the older couple that run this place, that keep me coming back.
author: Eric W.

description:
I come in here quite frequently before work (particularly on Sundays) for a coffee. The Korean couple that runs the place is quite dedicated as they are ALWAYS here from sunrise to sunset . The coffee is pretty good and always piping hot. 

If I'm hungry I'll get the "Sunrise" sandwich which is ham, cheese and egg on a bagel. It's pretty simple but holy crap is it tasty. 

They don't use like half their property which is weird to me. Sometimes while I'm waiting for my sandwich I'll think about what they could do with the space and its always difficult for me to think of anything.
author: Kyle K.

description:
We hurried in with high expectations.

I've been following Cups and Cakes http://www.yelp.com/biz/cups-and-cakes-bakery-san-francisco#hrid:wy6YxwViIcCd32h6u1U-ww/query:cups%20and%20cakes reviews for awhile now, so even after gorging ourselves on Shabu House, I was excited when I caught a glimpse of Cup and Cake Cafe's sign. We found rock-star parking and ran to the door. 

Though full from a huge meal, I was willing to stuff my stomach just a tad more -  for the sake of cupcake exploration.

As soon as we walked in, I knew something wasn't right.

The space was big, it was open late, and the woman behind the counter greeted as soon as we entered. But all I could see in their display glass, outside of a couple of cakes, were three lack-luster looking cupcakes. I asked the woman what flavors they had, knowing deep inside that this was not the place I had been salivating for.

The woman looked slightly confused and brought out the cupcakes. She did a quick Vanna White display of them, explaining that the vanilla was very popular. We finally decided on a chocolate cheesecake cupcake.

The woman beamed as she gave us each a tiny fork to eat with.

One bite - and I knew we were in the wrong place. It wasn't horrible, but I have a feeling Cup and Cake could easily share Starbuck's pastry chef. The small cake tasted generic and mass produced.

This place is a good find if you're in the area, and need a place to work late at night with free-wi, and some simple menu bites. Just don't put too much faith in their pastries. 

I'm sure we're not the only people who make this mistake. I noticed another excited man hurry in and order three cupcakes to go, as we were leaving.
author: Jessica T.

description:
I love hanging out on my laptop at cafés, sipping a latte.  The promise of free wi-fi and panini sandwiches brought me to the new Cup & Cake Café.  Cup & Cake - the name makes me think of cupcakes.  They have muffins, croissants, cookies (by Ultimate Cookie) and slices of cake (princess, strawberry shortcake, carrot, etc.) for sweets.  For savory goods, they have breakfast bagel sandwiches, deli sandwiches and panini sandwiches (3 types: turkey pesto, chicken pesto, ham).  

The café only occupies half of the space; the other half is not being used.  The walls are a warm yellow, the leather chairs are quite comfortable and there are a few electrical outlets within reach.  The owners (Asians) seem to like plants (orchids in particular).  The free wi-fi is secure, so ask for the password when you place your order.  The clientele is decidedly mixed - from teens to older Chinese.  

I had a medium latte ($3.45) and a chicken pesto panini ($6.95) served on a plate.  The latte wasn't so good.  The brew tasted like it was made with over-roasted beans; it had a bitter, burnt aftertaste.  The panini sandwich made with ciabatta bread was better but it didn't have much pesto flavor.  The mayo flavor was stronger.  Also, pieces kept falling out the sandwich which I find very annoying.  They did add a nice amount of fresh veggies - cucumbers, lettuce, tomatoes, and red onions.  It was made to order and they used roasted chicken pieces (dark meat only I think).

If you park in the neighborhoods, the time limit is 2 hours.  Restrooms available.  Credit cards accepted.
author: Lolia S.

description:
Cup & Cake provides a quiet, spacious, and hipster-free study environment.  

There is plentiful seating next to the wide windows that invite distraction from the work at hand.  However, the ample seating is limited to small tables that are difficult to push together for bigger groups due to the obstructing decor.  

The Vanilla Latte is strongly brewed, wonderfully sweetened, and hardy enough to enhance focus despite the rigors of a long day.  Although a tad expensive for a drink, the convenient restroom and glitch-free wireless more than made up for it.

Would consider CCC for future study opportunities!
author: Andrew M.

description:
I love this local, mom's and pop's cafe!
I get my latte here every morning for me and my boss. (she loves their latte better than starbucks)
it is owned by a korean couple. very nice people. they know my name already.
very clean, peaceful and quiet (best place to get homework done)

and most importantly, the bathroom is clean! (if bathroom is clean, employees are clean, then the food and drinks are clean)
bit over price but it's a locally-owned store, so i guess they have a reason to put an extra cent in there.

 all-in-all, my fav coffee spot!
author: J B.

description:
Will not be coming back here.
Came in around 630 with my roommate. We spent the whole day studying and needed a sugar fix badly. I personally wanted red velvet cake, which I read mostly positive reviews about. or mini cupcakes. or any other kind of cute asian pastry. 
The selection was very small and nothing looked super fresh. We should have taken the hint and left...but no....
I got a princess cake and a tea for $6 something. My roomie got an eclair which she spit out after the first bite. It tasted old. The princess cake did not taste fresh either. Overall it was a sad experience.
The peach tea was good though.
We were so sad we had to go to mels diner to get cherry pie to save the night......
and now....
back to studying *cries*
author: Yuliya R.

description:
I love little places like this.  It makes me fall in love with areas like the inner Richmond.  I like how there is actually space in this cafe to do work.  

I stopped in and got a cup of coffee and a muffin.  The coffee was a little on the bitter side.  They only had creamer on the counter, no milk choices.  The muffin, bran oat, was pretty good I must say.  It wasn't the best muffin on the planet but it was not dry.

I think the biggest thing this place has going for it though is space.  It is really relaxing to be in this cafe.  I would go back if I lived in this neighborhood.
author: Amanda C.

description:
I stopped by here after my appointment in the neighborhood.  This was a little bit after 1:30 pm (after the crazy lunch madness) but the line was 3-people deep.

After waiting in line for a bit, I found out why there was a line to begin with.  It appears the owner is sort of a micro-manager.   He was practically breathing down that poor cashier's neck to make sure she rang up the orders correctly and made the right change.  They have a standard cash register that actually tells you what the change will be (I grew up in a world where you had to figure out change yourself -- using your head!  Yes I was in food services as a teen).  It's not like those fancy registers in Starbucks etc.  That poor cashier was so flustered.  I'm sure she can perform better without the constant oversight.

When it was my turn to order, she rang me up correctly but before she can give me change (I gave her $10 for a $8+ bill), micro manager, says "wait" and he proceeds to look over her shoulder to see if she rang me up correctly.  I think that is really rude.  If you don't trust your employee, then don't hire them!  Deduct one star for being a damn register Nazi.

I ordered a ham panini.  The panini took about 10 minutes to make.  I was beginning to worry that they forgot about me.  The lady behind the deli finally brought my order to my table.  They just threw the panini on top of a piece of wax paper on a cafeteria tray.   No plate, nothing.  This works if you order at a donut shop and even a take out dim sum place but when you're striving to be fancy schmancy, the presentation is tacky.  I'm not going to complain because they are new so the tray is somewhat clean.  However, if they stick around long enough, they may consider serving the sandwiches on a plate.  I doubt a lot of these places actually wash the serving trays.  Deduct one star for the tacky presentation.

How's the sandwich?  The ham panini was actually really good!  Lots of meat, red peppers and cheese.  The panini was also served hot.  Yummy yummy!  One of the best panini's I've eaten.

They also serve various pastries and faux Starbucks drinks as well (frappe, etc.).

Cafe was nice and airy. I actually enjoyed sitting here.

Will try again when I'm in the neighborhood.  To the manager, lay off your employees or you'll have so much turn over you'll end up being the cashier yourself!
author: Wendy H.

description:
Pretty decent breakfast sandwiches and close proximity to USF. The coffee I ordered was a delicious iced latte. 

The owners are very sweet and friendly.   :)
author: Mayraa E.

description:
This Cafe is just down the street form my apartment, so I will openly admit that I 'MAY' have a bias. After all they do keep me caffeinated.

Mom and Pop shop, no corporate franchise here. The best part is the owner and his wife are almost constantly working there, they are really nice and always make you feel welcome.

The food is great, I eat there more than I should. The only bad that I can find to say (that holds me back from giving it a 5 star rating) is their food pricing is a little high, by my standards, and I am an admitted cheap ass, so take that critique as you will. 
But look at the photo of the sandwich on the review screen, this ain't no grilled cheese stand, their food is over the top.
author: Dr. L.

description:
GREAT SERVICE!!

The couple who I assume owns this business is incredibly nice. Always ready with a smile and they managed to pick up my name after I had come in maybe twice. This spot is right on my way to work/school and they are quick to make my order (which they have memorized: sunset bagel and large chai latte). I frequent this spot during the weekend and sometimes Fridays to catch up on some homework. I have visited other cafes in the past where I've had to buy a cup of coffee every hour to keep using the net, but not here! You get the password at the counter while placing your order, and I have never seen any worker hassle someone to buy more coffee just to keep the net access. The noise level is never above a low hum, which is perfect. Overall, great little neighborhood spot.
author: Tiffany M.

description: I was in a big hurry early on a weekend morning, and I had planned to stop at Earth's Cup coffee, but they were closed even though they were supposed to be open according to the sign, so I drove until I spotted this place. I was in and out with a latte in-hand and breakfast sandwiches. The food was good and not terribly expensive. I could see myself returning for the same thing.
author: Yolanda Y.

description:
Cute little "Mom & Pop Shop"
The Korean owners are so friendly!  They really do make you feel welcome, unlike some big corporate stores...  The coffee is fresh and good!  They make it just the way you want it.  I stop by once and awhile, the turkey bacon sandwich is very good!  Simple, but great tasting!  It's not close to me, so I don't stop in as much as I would like to, but when I'm in the area, it's worth stopping in!
author: C J.

description: 1 day I went to go grab a cup of coffee there, I go back because I need to go to the bathroom and he doesn't recognize me and so he did not let me to go in. What kind of person denies another person the ability to go to the bathroom! The coffee was fine but the owners are extremely mean and frankly I'd prefer my money to go to people who are more kind...
author: Brian P.

description:
Cake with a shrimp fork. You heard me. 

Fun points for that, plus the good coffee (dependable and solid, just the thing after a long walk down the hill from my doctor's office). Free wi-fi: a nice plus. 

Still, order a piece of cake here, and you'll get it served to you with a SHRIMP FORK. 

Choose wisely, my friends. You will be eating your piece of cake for a long, looooonnnng time.
author: Anne B.

description:
A year ago last January, I was planning a birthday party for my little girl. I saw Cup & Cake on my way home from Trader Joe's and thought I'd give them a try. I bought a BEAUTIFUL red velvet cake; everyone at the party was over the moon with it. Kids and adults alike!

This January, I called to order cupcakes for my daughter's class bd party. I spoke with the owner. I'd told him that "the cake the year before was a huge hit and...".  He interrupted & corrected me that it couldn't have been them because they've "never made cakes". Huh? I distinctly remembered the storefront, the cross streets and of course remembered the cake. Instead of moving on, he continued to debate it which rather put me off. The customer may not always be right, but don't argue with them just to make a point, right? I had to insist we change the subject. 

I ordered two dozen cupcakes, chocolate & vanilla. He asked if I wanted "Happy Birthday" written across them and I said yes. When he gave me my total I nearly swallowed my tongue - $76. "For cupcakes??!" I asked. He explained that all organic ingredients were used, etc. Now that I don't fault him for. The world of cupcakes I grew up in is NOT the cupcake of today. I now understand that $3 for a cupcake is the going rate. However I'm not a Marina Mom. My sensibilities will not allow me to spend $76 on cupcakes for a classroom of Kindergartners who would be wearing half of them down the fronts of their shirts. 

I went to Trader Joe's, bought a large box of chocolate cupcake mix and another box of frosting mix. They made two dozen gorgeous, delicious chocolate cupcakes for under $6.

Quite by chance, I recently stumbled upon the receipt for that red velvet cake. It read "Cup & Cake Cafe" - 3500 Geary Blvd...
author: S S.

description:
I was in the area the other day and had some time to kill (and I really wanted to finish my book!), so I stopped by Cup and Cake Cafe. I ordered a small cappuccino ($2.50), which was freshly made and piping hot. The family running the cafe was very nice. They had a lot of small tables and straight back chairs around, but I managed to grab one of the few comfy armchairs and settled in with my book. The music playing was soothing and the tables were spaced out enough so that I wouldn't distract/be distracted by the next table.

All in all, I'd definitely return if I was in the area!
author: Amanda K.

description:
Pretty disappointing. I'd been wanting to go to this place ever since it moved in a few doors down from Panchos. So years. But never went in for one reason or another (mostly the reason being that once I get my burrito, I want to jump into my car and go eat it). I finally went the other day and found the service to be bad, the desserts old and not made in the store, and flies buzzing around inside the muffin display case.

So I walk in, and am ignored for a good 10 minutes while the owner and two employees look at some piece of machinery. I just stand there waiting, because I'm a patient person and don't want to be a jerk. Finally someone comes over and I start to tell him what I want. He asks me three more times to repeat what I want. All the while I'm not one, not two, but several little flies buzz around inside the muffin display case in front of me. So so gross. I should have turned around and left, but I wanted to finally get some of these cupcakes I assumed they had, since the place is called "Cup & Cake". I asked for two cupcakes, one for me and one for my husband. Vanilla and chocolate. The guy opens a plastic container with the cupcakes in it and that is when I realized that these are store bought cupcakes from, like, Safeway or some other grocery store. At that point my heart sank a bit more and I knew that my hopes and dreams of finding a decent cupcake in this city was yet again dashed. But I went ahead and got the cupcakes he brought out, because after seeing all of the flies inside the muffin case I was just glad that the cupcakes weren't out of their plastic container.

Greasy cupcakes, and weird oily frosting. I think they'd been in there for quite a few days, too. Inedible. We ended up throwing them away. This is something that never happens in my house. A dessert has to be pretty bad for us not to eat it.

Huge waste of money. No wonder the place was completely empty.
author: Shona S.

description:
I love Cup & Cake!! Usually I'll come in here every once in a while to get my latte before class, and the owners are so sweet! They will always greet you with a smile and they've been able to get down my usual order, which is pretty cool! Their drinks are always hot , and the lox bagel is delicious too. 

I'm always tempted to try the sweets that surround the counter, but I've had to resist. Maybe one day I'll break down one day since they are very tempting!
author: Lisa B.

description:
A friend of mine introduced me to this cafe, and we went there to study. I was kind of wary, as I've had issues with some cafes I used to study at (ex. being dirty, loud, etc.) This place was perfect! Everyone who worked there was very friendly, the seats were comfortable, and the drinks and food were decently priced, which for me is important, being a college student and all. I studied for 7 hours there without interruption--it was probably one of my most productive studying sessions ever.

The reason I gave this place 4 stars instead of 5 is the food, which is good but not great. It's pretty good for a college student like me, but not so for people who may go for the food and such rather than to study =)
author: Jenn C.

description: Very sweet cafe with decent selection of sandwiches, bagels, teas, coffees, etc. The set-up is a bit dated and they blast the radio station KOIT, which can get annoying both because I'm trying to study and because the music is oftentimes just bad. But the customer service is great--the owners/employees are kind, helpful, and courteous.
author: H N.

description:
Ambience, check

WIFI, check

Red velvet cake, check

Cupcakes, check!!!

Had been wanting to drop by this place and today was the chance for me to do it.

I had 2 minutes to make this visit good and get something to satisfy my cravings for this place.

The food showcase was not that big but the cafe was HUGE. Nice and pleasant. Saw a few patrons on their laptops surfing the net. A sign that this is a good place to hangout. 

The service was good too. The asian guy at the counter was shy (I have that affect on people, hah!) but prompt in service. 

Was surprised their cupcakes are only $1.90. I tried the red velvet slice of cake for $3.50...huge! The taste was better than OK, did not reach fantastic though but enough to satisfy my cravings. 

Will be back...maybe if I was given another 5 minutes in this place, I will update my review :)
author: Elly G.

description:
Looking for something quick and easy while I was filling up my car, my boyfriend ran across the street and picked us up two sandwiches.  While there, he called to confirm that I wanted a cheese sandwich, extra mustard, all veggies and jalapenos.  He got pastrami and cheese.  Both on dutch crunch bread.  

His sandwich was all bread, a couple slices of meat and cheese.   My sandwich was bread, american cheese and two pieces of lettuce.  Dry.  The bread was not good.  The cheese was not good.  The  lettuce was the only thing I ate.  

The counter from which he ordered was too high for him see what was being made.  As he paid and was putting a dollar in the tip bucket, the sandwich maker prompted him to give her two dollars as a tip.  It wasn't until we were already on our way out of SF that I opened my sandwich and saw what she gave me.  The woman manning the counter did not understand the english language but understood the concept of tipping.

The sandwiches are not cheap - approx $6.50 for each one.

If this is your shop, and you care, I would take a look around and make some changes.  Until then, order from Mels which is just east of the shop by two blocks.
author: J. M.

description: It was open at least for a Saturday at 0800, I wanted to try it. Owners were a bit cold but food and coffee up to par.
author: Kevin L.

description: The sandwich was delicious and fresh, and the latte was definitely better than Starbucks. The only reason I gave it a 4 instead of a 5 is that they kinda nickel and dime you on prices. An extra .50 cents for cibatta bed, and another .50 for Swiss cheese. Otherwise this is beyond lovely, calm and delicious. :)
author: Kate B.

description:
I think this place is amazing! Free internet is always a plus.  The place is quiet enough that you can get a lot of work done.  I had the mocha here which was really good.  I also recommend getting the bagel as well, they toasted it just right..very good :) 

Mocha $2.95
Bagel w/peanut butter $1.75

The mom and pop that owns this place also runs it themselves. They are super friendly  :)
author: Be. N.

description:
I like the free wifi.
I like the comfy leather chairs with tables at appropriate heights.
I like that it's relatively quiet.
I like the fast, efficient service.
I like the nonfat latte thats made just right.
I like that it only cost me 3 bucks.

Me likey.
author: Vanessa T.

description:
Giving this place more than three starts is beyond my comprehension, and my opinion has been formed over the course of many months studying here.

Pros: 
-It's convenient to my place (adjust according to your actual distance to Cup & Cake Cafe)
-There is always seating - even if it is the bizarre unfinished back half of the building where the chair/table height ratio is completely off. Sit back there and imagine what it would be like to live as a dwarf.
-Classical music at all times. You are not subject to the whim of a barista's mood (and often terrible taste) in music as at most coffee shops.

Cons:
-I spent countless hours studying here and always consumed about $5 of food/drink per 3-4 hours, yet the owners acted like they'd never seen me before every time I walked in.
-The coffe is marginal. It's passable, but beware anyplace where a small americano is made with a single shot.
-Pastries, cookies, etc. are hit or miss - sometimes very fresh, sometimes clearly past their prime.
-It is either like a solarium (huge windows) or a freezer (huge windows) in here at all times. Dress in layers.

Walking just a few blocks you have:
-Earth's coffee (1 block - substantially better coffee and friendlier service)
-Velo Rouge (a bit further, but verifiably GOOD coffee, good food and friendly service)
-NOW quite close one has 50/50 (east on Geary) which is the hands-down cafe winner in the neighborhood.
author: r g.

description:
The Short Story: 
1. This is my last option for lunch in the area. 
2. The friendliness of the staff and price of the lunch-sandwiches ($5-8) doesn't overcome the just-adequate food. 

The Long Story: 

It's been a while since this place first opened, and I've held out hope - but reality doesn't always come out to what we cross our fingers for. 

I've relegated this lunch option to the "Damn, I really don' t have time for anything except what's real close, and I had a burrito yesterday AND the day before." 

If you find yourself here waiting for whatever is next on your agenda, I can still recommend the scones and the chicken panini with some sense of confidence. 

The latter sandwich is going to take some time, so perhaps get an adequate coffee... I am more of a tea fan, but the loose leaves in the glass jars have been there since my initial review. 

On the plus - there is plenty of space to sit down and spread out. If you want a private conversation, go sit in the back... it's practically a full block away from the counter and the rest of the store. 

Lastly, and this may be the biggest plus for some - but the folks that run the place really are quite nice. If you need a smile, you'll have them in spades.
author: Razoo D.

description:
What a delightful spot - and finally, a large, spacious cafe that doesn't have laptop users typing away on top of friends chatting away on top of babies crying away. They have a nice, abbreviated selection of baked goods, sandwiches and drinks that satisfy nicely. I enjoyed a really good BLT on very fresh french bread that had a perfectly crusty crust and soft middle. And their chai is very good - vanilla-spiced.

I also noted that they have computer stations for those in need. And overall, the space is just really clean and nicely organized, not to mention the staff is friendly.
author: Kiesha R.

description:
I came here to meet with a potential craigslist buyer and the family running the business from behind the counter was really friendly when I walked in. All I ordered was a cup of tea (~$1.25) and sat down right in front of the counter. 

After sitting down, I saw all the cookies and cupcakes that were on display... yum, I wish I had ordered one but I'm really trying to lose some weight so I decided against ordering. Now that I look back on it, I think I made a mistake. 

People came in ordering sandwiches so I can also assume that the sandwiches are delicious too. Try the pastrami, two people ordered it while I was there!

The atmosphere is great, free wi-fi and laid back staff that allowed me to meet with a buyer even though it looked like we were dealing drugs... haha. Great place, and will come back to try some cupcakes.
author: Christina B.

description:
Okay. I'll admit it. I'm a skank for free internet. 

The promise of free wifi at a cafe can make me travel across town in order to avoid paying hourly internet charges and causes me to instead spend the money on gasoline, which, when I look at it, is simply trading one payment for another. Wow, what retarded logic. Thank god I'm not in finance.

The fact that I think about this in such a rational sense is no doubt spurred on by the double shot of espresso that Cup and Cake Cafe has poured into my strong coffee. Coming in 3.95, the red eye better be strong. It does what any strong coffee does and that is, makes my breath smell and require curiously strong mints. Wonderful litmus test if you ask me. 

A house coffee costs 1.50, 1.75, and 1.95 for the S/M/L sizes and you can get flavored espresso shots for .50 extra. Cup & Cake Cafe has a very broad selection at moderate prices, enough to compliment any coffee drinker's nummy desires. They have an assortment of cup cakes (they appear store bought), mousses, cheesecake, muffins, croissants, bagels, cookies, and even red velvet cake. They even make sandwiches and paninis. I had a white chocolate hazelnut cookie and my companion, a chai. Both were decent..

But back to the free wifi. The wifi I drove across the bridge for, in short, is spotty and intermittent. In fact, I lost about an hours worth of work because I could not save what I was working on (SasS drawback). This translates to redoing work. 

I am not a fan of losing work because I'm a lazy bastard. I'd rather do something right the first time so I don't have to redo it. I've used this line in job interviews. Try it. It works and speaks as a testament to your quality of work. 

Since that was the case, I concluded that if you want to simply browse on the computer while enjoying a relaxing afternoon, then this is a good place for you. However, if you are actually doing work, the dropped wifi signal will frustrate and pwn your calm collected attitude, causing you to want to run out and frag everything in sight. 

Luckily, the only victims will be baked goods.
author: Jason C.

description: This is the most disgusting cafe I've ever been in. The man sold me a fruit tart that had molds on it. When I showed it to him, he said it was whipped cream. Good thing the woman working there saw it and she apologized. She gave me a different dessert but the man didn't even apologize or offer a refund. I highly recommend walking to EARTH'S COFFEE on geary & commonwealth if you want good food and coffee.
author: Ace B.

description:
Great location, my go-to cafe because it's so close and opens pretty late (til 9p).

Coffee is decent, baked goods are not made on the premise, but tons of natural light (bring you sunglass on sunny days, the glare off the floor can be kind of unbearable), lots of tables & chairs, outlet and wifi--the wifi is finicky sometimes, the connection drops pretty often :(  But it's free and a great short escape from my room.

I think one of the best thing about cup & cake is the service, the nice korean man at the cashier reminds me of my grandpa.  :) -- that gets the extra star
author: kate y.

description:
Came here last night for dessert - I always pass this place when I'm sitting on the bus..and thought it was such a cute name so I had try it out. We care here for the purpose of getting some cake. It's a cute neighborhood cafe' that has a older couple (Korean?) working there. We got there around 7:30pm and it had like 2 tables filled up. Not really packed at all. They close at 9, so probably people who actually want to study go to somewhere that closes later. It's actually a pretty big space..a couple of TV's, sofa's, chair's and tables. Nothing really matches here at all. But its comfortable and homely looking. Bathroom was clean, so that's def a plus! 

On their menu they have a variety of sandwiches and drinks - both tea and coffee. I came here for cake - so I looked at their selection of desserts - which wasn't bad, but wasn't great. They have different kinds of cakes, pies, mousse cakes, cookies, and eclairs. I ended up getting a slice of their strawberry creme cake and a slice of tiramasu both $4.50 each. The cakes were pretty good - all very fresh tasting, and very moist. It wasn't too sweet and it wasn't bland and dry. Both were very yummy - tho I gotta admit the tiramasu was probably my fav out of the two! 

They have free wifi, and the place is quiet. Not noisy like some other cafes or coffee shops can be. It's a pretty big space, so its easy to get somewhere to sit. Plenty of street parking at night too. It's a nice neighborhood cafe if you want to get a cup of coffee or dessert and just sit and talk.
author: Betty S.

description:
Addendum:

You know why else I appreciate this place? Because they have wide, comfy ass chairs. Brown leather seats I could fall in if I wanted to-- or, as I'm doing now, sit in cross-legged. I'm so comfortable right now I could take a nap if I didn't have a final paper to write.

This is the cafe to go to if you're in for some long term ass to chair bonding.
author: Le V.

description: Don't come here for cupcakes.. do come for the amazing and cute owners, consistently great coffee and delicious breakfast sandwiches!
author: Dana S.

description:
Free wi-fi.
Huge array panel window, plenty of natural light front half.
The wife owner attentively prepare you sandwich(es), seriously just    
             like mom does...well my mom...well sliced veg and delicately 
             put together.
Large back area for many moderate size groups
Secued wi-fi (obtain password from owner)
author: S.K. Y.

description:
Oh Cup and Cake you will be the sugary death of me! 

My internship is only a block away from here.. so I am conveniently located. However if you are in the area def. make a trip. I have to speak for the sandwiches and baked goods.. which are AWESOME. I get the turkey pesto panini which comes with sun-dried tomatoes on ciabata bread. The cupcakes are wonderful and they have like 10 different cakes to chose from, I have tried the princess cake (OMG DECADENT).

The service is quick and friendly and the place has a lot of seating room and great sunshine! Now I am cutting this review off because I have made myself hungry for a cup and cake cookie! PEACE
author: Hailey P.

description:
It was more like a case of mistaken identity than serendipity that we stumbled upon this cafe. Don't come here thinking you're going to get this: http://www.yelp.com/biz/cups-and-cakes-bakery-san-francisco

We did, and we were disappointed.

The cute Korean couple who helped us were really sweet though, but a bit confused when we were asking about their selection of cupcakes. While they did have cupcakes, there were only 3 different kinds. Since we were already there, we decided to get a black and white cupcake, which was just ok.

It's a nice and spacious cafe with free wi-fi though -- just in case you happen to be in the Inner Richmond.
author: Connie C.

description:
Staring out the window. Watching the "76" ball spin across the street. Gas prices are $4.59. Thank god (sometimes) I don't drive in SF. Where am I sitting, you ask?

It's a new cafe--lots of space with comfortable pleather chairs, plenty of power outlets to plug in that laptop (or whatever else you like-a-pluggin') & FREE INTERNET.

There's some plants scattered throughout the shop, but the place itself lacks any exquisite charm. They offer a number of sandwiches, which I'll try someday...but have learned that when a place has just opened they need to get all the bugs worked out first.

So for now...thanks for the internets & friendly service, see you soon.
author: matt m.

description:
The older couple that own and run this place are awesome.  They make the best chai in the city.  Period.  I don't know how they do it.  But it's one of the things I look forward to every single week.  

This place is also one of the best cafes to go to if you want an atmosphere that is quiet and distraction free.  Read: non-hipster.  Don't get me wrong, I love hipster cafes.  But if you really need to focus on cranking a couple chapters on your great American novel or great American term paper this is the place to go.
author: Eric W.

description:
I am sad to see this place with only 3.5-ish stars. The coffee isn't as divine as blue bottle or four barrel, but it's not trying to be. There's much more to this cafe than decent coffee. It's a great local cafe void of pretentious vibes and there's never a long wait.
I love neighborhood places that let patrons post up signs for their shows, venues, biz cards, etc. There's free wireless and nice big windows. It's great for meeting with someone and not feeling like you have to shout, or that everyone can hear you. Due to the low-key atmosphere, it's great for getting a lot of work done.
They have a wide variety of baked goods, with gems like red velvet or carrot cake and gourmet looking/tasting sweets. They make good sandwiches fresh when you order, and have a cooler stacked with tons of bottled drinks and edibles. They have Martinelli's sparkling apple juice! 
They're all about making your coffee drink how you want it, which is sweet. 
The owners, are probably the best part. They're so friendly and it resonates throughout the cafe. I've been a barista before, and it's not easy to keep a positive attitude so consistently. I've never felt rushed out of the cafe around closing. 
Good hours too.
author: R J.

description: FYI:  This place closes at 8:00PM Sundays, and 9:00PM other days
author: Cora L.

description: I came here one morning for a breakfast date with my son. We had all really enjoyed our pastries. The coffee was really good, nice and strong, just how I like it. And my son really enjoyed his chocolate milk, which I requested to just make slightly warm and they made just right. The people working there were very nice. We will be back.
author: Maya L.

description:
With a name like Cup & Cake, you'd think they'd have cake and possibly cupcakes. But, I guess the Cup means cup you drink out of.

Drove by this place last week and made a point to check it out w/ a friend because it looked quaint, and the name caught my attention. 

The place has a welcoming, relaxed feel. The couple at the counter (owners ?) were very nice. However, there wasn't really any cake except 1 option of cheesecake. I asked  if the cheesecake was fresh. I was told it was. But, it wasn't. It tasted like it had been freezer burned. My friend had a chocolate chip cupcake that was just ok. I ordered a latte. It was more like a cafe au lait. 

This seems like a great local hangout and a place you could sit around for hours without getting kicked out. So, if you're looking to read and have a cup of coffee, this place is perfect!

Price Note:
2 Pastries, 2 small coffees= $11.50 (minus the tip)
author: Carolina P.

description:
This place is THE BEST. 
If you need a place to study or just goof around online, this is the best place to go. Not only do they provide free wireless, but the atmosphere is calm and relaxing for a busy-bee with a hangover. They play concerto music, which i thought would bug me, but it's low in volume and makes the place kinda cozy, maybe i'm really a Mozzart type of guy deep on the inside.

Plus! They have great bagel sandwhiches, maybe that's because they have the TRUE NEW YORK style bagels, fresh from House of Bagels on Geary. Oh yeah, so not only can i go to house of bagels for my munchies, but i can even get their awesome grub at my new favorite cafe. 

These people are nice, efficient, produce good food, and keep their cafe clean. 

In short, this place is Awesome.
author: Jason E.

description: They served a five-day old cupcake!  I asked for a red velvet and they gave one with hearts and sprinkles.  I took a bite and the cake had no moisture and the frosting was rock hard.  The frosting did not taste like cream cheese frosting at all when I realized it was likely that the cupcake was likely sitting there since Valentines Day five days earlier.  So nasty.
author: Parag G.

description:
Thanks to the free WiFi offered at Cup & Cake Cafe I am able to take a few minutes out of my study time to write a lovely review of the place.

I was driving down Geary Blvd this evening thinking of a place to study and the words 'expresso' and 'free WiFi' immediately caught my attention. I was lucky since there was parking right in front for me- it was meant to be!

I've been here for the past two hours studying away while sipping on my white mocha (they have both syrup AND powder- awesome!) and enjoying a cute little banana with vanilla topping cupcake. They have a variety of stuff here including sandwiches, pastries, crossants, bagels, scones, cute desserts such as strawberry shortcake, slices of princess cakes, eclairs, etc... There is plenty of light in here and the seating is quite comfy. The ladies working behind the counter are so sweet and friendly! 

The space is huge and it looks as if the cafe is currently taking up only half of its space. There are so many plants in here and the environment is just warm and welcoming. During the past 2 hours there have been many people coming in and out- many buying sandwiches or pastries to go. The restroom here is clean- huge plus!
author: M W.

description:
This place used to be a liquor store and then they closed for a while and reopened as this cute little cafe. 

The food is good. They make nice sandwiches and salads. The coffee is decent and the staff is friendly. 

They do offer free wifi which is fantastic!!!
author: A. S.

description:
I'm sitting here using their free WiFi as I type this review, but don't take that as me being partial to this cafe. Nevermind, go ahead, I am partial to this place.

Its a shame this cafe's name has such a close and mistakable resemblance to the famed bakery, then maybe (as Matt O. mentioned) Cup & Cake CAFE would have a clean slate and no other expectations.

It is a great neighborhood spot. I come here on the days where I desperately need to get out of my tiny cooped up Inner Richmond apartment. I usually stick around for a few hours, surrounded by other WiFi users who probably needed the change of scenery as well. 

Perks:
_ There is always usually a table and outlet available. Hopefully that doesn't change after I finish this review.
_ Fresh baked goods, note this is still not a bakery, so take what you can.
_ Fresh brewed iced tea made to order (I just found this out today on a 65 degree day in January). I love that (the ice tea part, not the odd weather--which kind of freaks me out).
_ FREE Wifi

I'd also like to add that its great to support your local small business owner, the couple that owns Cup & Cake just happens to be very friendly.
author: kate r.

description:
I guess by the name of the place, I assumed it would be a cupcake extravaganza.  Er...no...

After scanning the cases and counters looking for cupcakes, I finally saw them in a covered cake plate -- yes, all 6 of them.  I ordered a chocolate cupcake and scarfed it down in the car.  It was good, but the quality reminded me of something I would get at a bake sale -- tasty enough, but not bakery quality.  But, hey...it was better and moister than anything I've had at Kara's Cupcakes.
author: M L.

description:
Wonderful cafe that is great for getting work done! I came in for two reasons: caffeine and wifi. I was very pleased by the assortment of desserts and the large quiet atmosphere. The wifi is free and there are plenty of plugs for easy computer charging. I definitely will be back to this place when I need a quiet, warm place to get things done (and snacks, of course). 

I have been back many times. Sometimes they close early.
author: Joshua S.

description:
Minus one for a $2.50 plain croissant. Who the fuk pays that much for a plain croissant? ME. damn coffee shop prices

Minus one for slowww service

+ one for free wifi
+ one for nice, clean decor
+ one for big open space but - .5 for not many tables

so it's really 2.5 stars, but 3 for potential to be better
author: Nurse Z.

description: Sitting in this cafe right now using their complimentary internet.  I bring my car to the Firestone a few blocks away when I need tire alignment fixed or an oil change.  I almost always come to this cafe because of the great staff and ambiance.  It is always bright enough to read in here (unlike many other coffee shops).  Today, I got a bagel, hot chocolate, internet and  a nice place to spend a few hours relaxing for about $7.
author: STEVE L.

description:
I really wanted to like this place.  From the outside, it looks really promising.  The cafe is huge, the front is a cafe and I have no idea what the back is for, there's retail shelves everywhere.  Free wifi too.

Coffee was mediocre, I've had better at work.  The princess cake was ok.

Service was good.  The Korean couple who helped us were really nice but a bit disorganized.  

2 stars for the food and 1 star just for getting rid of the old liquor store that was here before the cafe took over.
author: J L.

description:
MMM this place is so good!  Their veggie sandwich is soo good on a french roll. MM and the people that work there are so nice! The place is spacious and it has Wi-Fi. Yay!

MM chocolate croissant
author: L O.

description: liked the space but the coffee was so-so.....they also charge extra for wi-fi.  i'll skip this place in future.
author: Alison M.

description:
Most of the less-flattering reviews are from customers who expected fabulous cupcakes and pastries.

But the name of the place aside, this coffee shop is all about:

Clean, comfortable
Free WiFi
Big, spaceous layout
Good coffee.

If you come at it from that angle, you will enjoy the place.  I think their target market is mostly students from USF who you usually see packed into the Laurel Heights Starshmuks like sardines.

Remember, the place is not a dessert cafe!
author: Matt O.

description: I like the atmosphere. It's never busy. I come here a bit because it's next to the place where I get my haircut, so it's a nice waiting place. Pastries are never great, to be honest, but the owners are so nice and friendly, and they're reason enough to come back.
author: Raquel R.

description:
Cupcake selection was zero, ok, there was 2 kinds: chocolate and vanilla. So I won't give it a 5 star. very decieving name...

We had sandwiches, a hot chocolate, a scone, an italian soda, and 1 vanilla cupcake. It was all pretty good. Not above standards but definately not below.

Small tables, good service, good pastry selection = approval.
author: Sydney T.

description:
A pretty poor showing in terms of variety of pastries, sweets, cakes, etc.  Red velvet cake wasn't bad but wasn't a stand-out either. 
Ambiance is ok but I wouldn't necessarily come back.
author: Cathy L.

description: I love this place. The owners are ultra-friendly and pleasant, remember your names, and are just good people.  The space is wide open, well-lit, with free wifi, and the selection is pretty good. The hot chocolate is tasty, sandwiches are well made, and it's just a great place to hang out, have a meeting, or grab a snack.
author: Jason K.

description: fresh coffee evn if I came here at 2pm.. lots of sweets to chose from. Nice friendly owners and really good vegan chocolate chip cookies.
author: Kayla G.

description:
I can't speak for every aspect of this place, but when I dropped in to grab a treat it looked well designed, spacious and people seemed to be enjoying the free wifi.  

My gf got a cupcake - it was pretty good, had frosting that tasted like real whipped cream (albeit a little frozen).  I got a M&M chocolate chip cookie - very tasty, chewy, but not underdone.  Together they cost $3.70.  I'd come back for free wifi and to have another cookie.  I'll update if I end up there again.
author: Thor M.

description: I love this place! I work across the street and come here just about every time I go out to lunch. It has a nice atmosphere, and the people working their are very friendly. I almost always get a soy chai latte when I go, it is amazing!! I don't know what they do, but they make it the best! They have very good prices, and I think a pretty good selection!
author: Jessica C.

description:
I have been anticipating the opening of this café since the liquor store closed. I came in on week day after work. I had a sweet tooth and wanted to try their cakes. They had an enticing selection: Princess cake with a pink rose on top, raspberry chocolate cake, tiramisu, chocolate croissants, a few muffins, and carrot cake. I didn't know which to get - the girl behind the counter suggested the raspberry chocolate but it looked too rich for me. I picked my default - tiramisu. The cake was mediocre. I could taste the liquor and a slight coffee flavor but other than that it was bland. The texture of the cake was ok, the bottom 3 layers were moist but the top layer of crème was starting to dry out and harden. On a good note, the cake had just the right amount of sweetness. 

I'm just glad that there's a café in this area that's not a Starbucks or Peet's. This café is located in a good location and the comfy chairs are a plus. It's a good place to hang out with a friend or for studying/reading. They offered a decent variety of coffee drinks and tea on their menu. I have to try their sandwiches and coffee drinks next time I visit!
author: Candace F.

description:
i *heart* this little place.  it's close to home and on the way to work.  i really don't come here for "good" coffee, which isn't bad by any means, it's decent.  i just prefer something way stronger.  anyway, i love this place not only for its location and convenience but because the owners are just two very lovely people.  they always remember my name, say hello enthusiastically, and start pouring my coffee before I even reach the counter. 

they have more than just coffee, there's a pretty decent selection of sandwiches, bagels, CAKES, cookies, and now they even have omelettes! :)  so if you're looking to start your morning off right with happy, friendly service and a decent cup of coffee then this is the place to go.

oh, they even carry my favorite kinds of granola bars! :D yay!
author: Sally T.

description:
I love this place! It's a mom and pop cafe, simple drinks (coffee, latte, italian sodas), simple food (sandwiches, pastries), CLEAN, and a nice place to chill with friends. The owners are really sweet. They used to run the liquor store on this site, but decided that it would better serve the community as a cafe.

Don't be such haters, people. I don't understand why some of the reviewers post low ratings just because the place is not what they expected it to be. There are no pretensions or false advertisements at Cup and Cake claiming to be something else (trendy, foodie, etc). It's a cute neighborhood coffeehouse. Take it for what it is.
author: G K.

description:
This place is on the way to work, so I regularly pop in to get my favorite morning food... the sunshine bagel (toasted bagel, with eggs, ham and cheese). It's no foodie delicacy, but I love one of these babies when I'm hungry, hung-over, and dreading going to work.
