Meanwhile, I'm going to get fat if I eat them every day so I try to keep it as a treat for Fridays. Or Mondays. Or as was the case this week, Monday and Thursday? Whatever. It's that yummy. And the coffee I get with it is great!

The staff is always friendly, greets me the second I walk through the door, and the service is prompt. 

Lastly, this place also rocks because I am usually disorganized, and will occasionally come in with NO cash and pay for a coffee ($1.50) with a credit card and they don't get annoyed with me. They're that fabulous. I love Cup and Cake!
author: Stephanie L.

description: Cute and quiet on a Saturday morning.  Very friendly owner, yummy lo-fat latte!  Spare but comfortable ambiance - very relaxing.
author: Kendra M.

description: I got my time wrong for a movie at The Bridge theater. So I had time to kill and figured I would find a cafe, grab a cup, read the paper and chill. This was the only place I could find up Geary (4 blocks or so from the theater). It served it's purpose. I killed time. The staff was friendly and it was a nice place to sit. The coffee was ok. I tried the red velvet cake and it was a bit dry. To be honest the sweets didn't look all that great.
author: Silvio S.

description:
I recently moved to the neighborhood from the Outer Richmond and have been looking for what could be the neighborhood corner coffee house.  Man was I disappointed when I ordered my nonfat au lait.  Instead of using freshly brewed coffee and adding steamed milk, the lady behind the counter reached for powdered coffee mix.  What's with that? Learn how to make a simple coffee drink! Needless to say, I did not enjoy my drink.  Total waste of $2! I guess Peet's in Laurel Village or Royal Ground a few blocks up are the places to go.

Angelina's on California at 22nd has spoiled me!
author: Debbie W.

description:
I wandered in off Geary looking for a bite to eat and my hunger was completely satisfied. I had a ham and swiss cheese sandwich at this lovely new caf and it was exactly up to my expectations. Big sandwich, fresh bread, clean cuts of meat. It was all good.

I'm a big fan of small establishments where you can see where the money that you drop goes to, instead of these huge corporations all over the place. That's a big plus for me, and this place feels good 

At least one of the owners was in presence when I went in the first day of their business. Really friendly people. There were flowers in vases, the place was clean and well kept. The staff at the counter was understandably jumpy the first day, but the food was wholesome and good. 

The chairs were comfy, you could sink into one and read a book if that's what you wanted to do. Also on that note there are ceiling to knee windows that allow for lots of natural light, no fluorescent glow during day light hours. Free wifi. Hot drinks. 

Go check it out if you're in need of a good filling meal and you're in the area. 

I might see you there.

"d".
author: d s.

description: Can I give zero stars? Don't go here! The staff are so horribly rude that there can't be any reason to spend a cent at this cafe. Really.
author: Molly R.

description:
Love this place! Fantastic lox & bagel w/ the right amount of cream cheese, thin sliced red onions and some alfalfa sprouts. GREAT!!
They also have great panini sandwiches and the bread is so fresh.
Excellent coffee prices for a good cup of joe.  They are open at 6:30 am and close at 8 pm.  A great locally owned place with very nice owners who care about their customers.  The free wifi is a nice bonus.
Just writing about this place and I want that delicious bagel that was toasted just right ....mmmmmm!!
author: Suzanne N.

description: They have free wifi, decent coffee, good selection of bagels and good sandwiches. The employees are really nice too!
author: Jessica B.

description: What a lovely place to relax, catch up with an old friend, or find some solitude to get some work or studying done.  One of the cleanest cafe's I've ever seen and the folks who run it are as nice as you could ever meet.  There is also complementary WiFi.  Food is very tasty.  I love mom & pop businesses like this!
author: Carter Y.

description:
I was on my way out of the city. Now, to you, this may mean that I was getting in my car with the destination of home in mind and that's where I'd go directly. 
But you'd be wrong my Friend. I can't leave the city in one shot. For me, it just can't be done. I've got to fully utilize that Bridge Toll and see what I can see. 
And that is how I went from O'Farrell & Mason clear to Ocean Beach.
I knew that I wanted some coffee, and I knew that my errand was in no way that innocent. I was on the hunt for sweets and I was gonna get 'em come hell or high water. 
So, I wandered and drove where the road took me, which happened to be a delightfully named little cafe with the promise of Cake, right in the title! datswhatimtalkinbout. I skipped on in (yes, that's how much I love the sweets) and ordered my black coffee and the cranberry oat flapjack. Oh, and hey the pecan bar for my.... Mom. Sooo not for me. God, how dare you insinuate gluttony on my part. Asshole.
Place is cute & clean, in a great neighborhood and has a lovely selection of well, cake, yeah and cookies and the like. I noticed that they can whip you up a nice sandwich or wrap as well. I cannot, ever, never pass up a pecan bar. This one is THE ONE. The fact that it was for my Mom lasted about 1 minute 37 seconds. 
Oh, the Pecan Bar. Bottom was a shortbread crust, middle a caramel chewy decadence with pecans throughout and on top. Honestly, they had me at the shortbread crust, but those pecans were perfection. toasted, crunchy and beautifully showcased in the salty, sweet caramel middle. Mmmm. I actually tried to put it away about half way through and show some self-restraint for God's sake, but seriously, who the hell am I trying to kid?

Now, what is a cranberry oat flapjack? Well, allow me to enlighten. In Europe you will find a cookie-like yummy that is eaten at breakfast, as a snack or in my case, as my breakfast dessert. It is toasted oats with either a honey or caramel binder and you can mix in whatever you wish, almonds, pecans, dried fruits - in this case, cranberries. Oh, this was awesome as well. Chewy, nutty and honey flavor with the sweet & sour of the cranberry, I loved it. Perhaps a little on the sweet side, but hey, that WAS the mission, after all - lest we forget. 

The Girls in there are helpful, nice and speedy but shit, even if they weren't, I'd be back like that fo some mo
author: Katie W.

description: FUCK! I thought this was the infamous Cups and Cake Bakery! Why must they have the same name!! I went into the cafe and I wondered where the hell are all of the cupcakes?!? But then they had cupcakes but not the ones that they make! The lady was very nice so I just bought a cupcake and used their restroom.
author: Janet Z.

description: I just think the name is misleading.... since they dont make cupcakes... i went in with full intention of getting myself one.... nope... they just had two kind and it looked like it came from safeway... so i didnt get any and just left....
author: Janet S.

description: I went here once, and that will probably be the only time I go. I didn't like anything about it except the name. I got a slice of chocolate cake and it was really bad. I'm not even that picky, but this was just an overall bad experience. I would not recommend this place, rather I would go to one of the other cafes close by.
author: Kate G.

description: Driving by Cup and Cake Cake, I knew I had to stop because of its name (maybe they have cupcakes!)  When walking inside, I realized that it was more spacious than what I thought it would be- tons of small tables to drink coffee or finish that project you have been dreading.  Immediately, I noticed their cutie cakes and sweets, like the heart shaped mousse cakes.  I decided to get one and a slice of red velvet.  After going to lunch (to which they waited in the car), the cakes were yummy and not "melted."  The red velvet was delicious- it was thick, almost like a pound cake, but was very good with the light cream cheese frosting.  The mousse cake was good- not the best I've had because of its lumpy consistancy.  However, Cup and Cake Cafe is great for a breakfast or dessert on- the- go.
author: Shannon W.

description: Sorry, folks!  :(  But the coffee was weak and only lukewarm at 7PM.  Didn't give me that kick that I was looking forward to.  Pastry selection was looking a bit bored as well...
author: Judy K.

description: I saw the sign, I was already wanting a cupcake before we went home, we swerved into the plentiful late-Sunday parking spots nearby, inside I found a chocolate cupcake with white frosting, I consumed it, I rested. Amen.
author: Emily M.

description: Well-lit, airy coffee shop with a pleasant staff & atmosphere. The owner noticed my table was wobbling a little and came over to fix it! Nice selection of looseleaf teas and cupcakes, which are totally my thing. Plus, you can get salads, bagels, BLTs, al the basics. Free wifi, quiet, and I love the plants. I study here all the time -- great student prices, too.
author: Emily R.

description:
I've never really found the need to go to a local coffee place while there are Starbucks places everywhere, but after visiting this one, I've been given an excuse to frequent one. It's clean and comfortable -- a great new hangout for the neighborhood!
I liked the scone, and the drink I ordered wasn't on the menu -- the girl making the drinks sort of made it up as she went, and it worked out well :-)
author: Rachel I.

description: I'm a huge sandwich fan. It's one of my favorite things to eat and this place does it right. I've tried a lot from here, the egg salad sandwich, turkey pesto, BLTA, the Apollo penini...... Julie makes if fresh and flavorful. I love this Mom & Pop place, whenever I'm in the area for lunch, this is where I go.
author: A. A.

description: Not the best chai or mocha I've ever had.  I was hoping for cup cakes? cake? More items for my sugar fix? But alas...no.  I do enjoy the crumb cake. Free wifi? Yes please. They have a long way to go with this place, so much space they could do a lot with it!
author: Jen C.

description: My sister had brought me a sandwich, I love Tuna sandwich and allot of places do not make good Tuna but this Cafe makes them the way I like it. Not to much Mayo, not too much Tuna. I could eat there sandwiches almost everyday. I actually want one right now. They put a whole bunch of toppings on my sandwich which I also love. I recommend this places for everyone. I will keep going back here. The owners are Korean and very nice.
author: Ge I.

description: Anti-starbucks neighborhood cafe.  Their chocolate cake hit the spot.  We sat here at night surrounded by pleasant music and peace.  Free wi-fi is available too!
author: Blu n.

description: This place is probably the most perfect place for college students or people who need a place away from the office/home to focus and get some work done.  I have not one single complaint.  They have free reliable wireless internet, outlet plugs ALL over the place, good espresso drinks (I usually go for the mocha which is reasonably priced), very clean, accessible restrooms, very comfortable chairs, allow debit card use on any purchase, and excellent lighting.  I have sometimes traveled 45 minutes on bus just to come to this cafe to get some of my graduate-level papers completed
author: Micah W.

description: Finally, a clean and comfy coffee shop to replace that disgusting abandoned liquor store!  Good coffee, some standard nibbles, a few sandwiches, and plenty of seating for some early afternoon study sessions.  I especially dig the fact that its a mom-and-pop shop
author: Vanessa K.

description: They remembered me from several years ago when they ran the liquor store there before the previous owners of the same lot went out of business. Everything there is pretty good and the place is clean with really comfy chairs.  Should really be a 3 star but they great me by name whenever I come in so that earns them an extra star. I'm not a coffee drinker but have tried their sandwiches and some of their baked goods and it's 3-4 for stars. Decent but not amazing but I have a feeling it will get better with time. I've always been greeted with a smile so that's a big plus too.
author: Jason H.

description: A relaxing, friendly cafe - tasty sandwiches, breakfast goodies, and smooth coffee. I like that they keep the radio tuned to classical.
author: J R.

description: I came back a month or so after its opening to finally try their paninis!  Success!  Simple, no fuss delectable paninis.  I had the turkey with (provolone?) cheese and sun-dried tomatoes.  It's not super gourmet, but it was inventive and scrumptious.  My co-worker agreed as she ate up her chicken pesto panini.  It was so good we didn't even miss our usual crispy chips that we'd get to accompany our sandwiches.  Again, they don't serve chips...
author: Marie B.

description: I liked this place just fine. The people were really friendly and there was free internet, but it wasn't as cozy as I like my coffee shops to be and there wasn't that much seating.  I would go back again sometime, but I feel that it is in such a busy area and I don't like to see all the cars flying by. But hey, that's just me.
author: Devon M.

description: I love chai tea and this place actually made a pretty good cup.  The desserts were alright, we had a fruit tart which didn't have enough fruit and took much tart in my opinion and something called a Princess Cake...go figure I was there with a bunch of "queens."  Fruit, tart, princess -- Queens.  Hahahaha.
author: Ming L.

description: I ended up taking my niece to this establishment due to the fact that I was craving a cupcake. Well, craving satisfied : )... I'm a huge fan of cupcakes and this one was up to par. Nice soft moist cupcake goodness that was evenly spreaded with frosting. Too much and your on the verge of a sugar rush! The prices were affordable, plus the space didn't hurt. As for the laptopping, I'm going to have to go there the next time I'm in frisco and need a spot to WiFi. The last time I went there sadly was no lap top to WiFi on. ( devestation surrounds me haha).. Unfortunaly my niece could not take part in my cuppy cake experience. due to her zoo trip (NOT GOOD) which landed her a spot next to me....watching....salivating.....wanting.....(okay you can have a bite!)....  ;  )............ahh cruella cruella...anyways.....definetly try this place for the cupcakes alone! I'm going back to try the chai. I read Kiesha's  review and any place that makes good chai is a friend of I.  Try it...
author: Honey B.

description: Surprising to read good reviews of the baked goods and coffee here. It's a good location, cozy space, and I'm sure the owners are nice, but they don't really know how to make good coffee or tea. My friend's chocolate mousse cake (from a bakery I hadn't heard of) was a tiny sliver for $3.25 and very tasteless. My chocolate/cheesecake cupcake was good, probably came from Just Desserts. My cappuccino was stale and watery. Her pot of tea was so weak she went and asked the woman to make another one with more tea in it. She obliged, to her credit, but seemed clueless as to how much tea to put in a pot. The one person at the counter did everything and though it wasn't crowded, seemed a little overmatched. They need to hire a barista or at least learn how to use their espresso machine and make decent tea!
author: L J.

description: I love this place.  Julie and Tony are so welcoming.  The atmosphere rocks for getting work done, and also for just sitting and chatting with a friend.  It is incredibly clean, and is a nice open space.  The chairs are cushy, and they stay open until 10pm, which is just right for me.  Great neighborhood cafe.
author: Marcia K.

description: OK, yay!  Wifi worked the next time I went in!!  Many people go in there for their baked goods, which to me, looks like they bought them from Costco to resell here.  I can't really speak on that because I've never purchased any of their cakes/pastries here.  Nice couple that runs the place, but you'd think they'd know how to make coffee drinks and run the register by now?  My small drink was seriously HALF coffee and HALF foamed milk. Nonetheless, I'll keep on coming and probably get tea instead.
author: Christine H.
